intro: Linaria spartea f. expansa, commonly known as the broadleaf toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, branching stems that can grow up to 60 cm in height, often covered with fine hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers in racemes, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
